page.title: 11Kennet and Avon Canal
page.content: the canal and a long existant stream which fed Oakhill Mill. There are some very healthy{water cress beds}here which are fed by the stream. We tasted the water cress and it was bitter, but Mrs. Wheatley said that it had to be properly washed as little snails stick to it. Further along the road is {Froxfield Bridge.}This is the{county {boundary}between{Wiltshire and {Berkshire.}We did some rubbings of the boundary signs. The Berkshire sign just gave the name, but the Wiltshire sign had a crest on it. The canal continues South with a lock. It is the{Froxfield Lower Lock, (lock no. 70) and is one of three locks known as the Froxfield Flight. However only one of these locks is in our section.The canal passes through fields called{The Barrack Fields.
